message.content:
cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.NE 

This paper is about a computational perceptual model for robots to learn and infer their body configuration using different sources of sensory information. The paper focuses on the application of this model to enable safe physical human-robot interaction. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.RO (Robotics). The paper also uses machine learning techniques such as Gaussian process regression and variational free energy minimization, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper uses visual information and models the body estimation as a minimization problem, which could place it in cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the use of predictive processing and sensory prediction errors suggests that the paper could also belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
